Get nectar cubes from bee card and put the cubes on the Honeycomb Card. Collect the honey cubes in the next run.

Switch the white / black nectar cubes to the numbers of honey cubes according to the card, and then put the honey cubes on BOTTLE Card. Every 8 honey cubes could convert into 1 CASTELLA Card.

Garden Side of the card  >  Nectar collecting

Collect 1/2/3/D nectar cubes from your own Garden Card and put the cubes on the bee card. The nectar cubes on the bee card could be used to produce honey.

How to use Greedy Bear Card

Bear attack: Put Greedy Bear Card, the Greedy Bear would eat all of the nectar cubes on the Honeycomb Side around the Greedy Bear, and also turn the Honeycomb Side into Garden Side.


    Goal of the game


When all the hexagon cards are out, the points are calculated by the total cubes on both the bee card, the bottle card, and the numbers of castella cakes.  The winner is the one who got the most points. If there are any Greedy Bear cards left, each Greedy Bear Card will deduct 1 honey cube on the honey card. If no honey cubes are on the honey Card, then no points would be deducted.

Name: The Battle of Kursk: The Card Game
Description:
Η διÎ¬σημη αρματομαχια του Β 'ΠαγκοσμÎ¯ου ΠολÎ­μου, μεταξÏ του ΚÏŒκκινου ΣτρατοÏ και του ΓερμανικοÏ ΣτρατοÏ, ζει μÎ­σα απÏŒ τις εξαιρετικÎ­ς κÎ¬ρτες του παιχνιδιοÏ. Τα ακριβÎ® στοιχεÎ¯α ÏŒλων των μονÎ¬δων, οι μοναδικÎ­ς τακτικÎ­ς, η στρατηγικÎ® υψηλοÏ επιπÎ­δου και η δυνατÏŒτητα δημιουργÎ¯ας μιας μοναδικÎ®ς σÏγκρουσης σε κÎ¬θε ξεκÎ¯νημα ενÏŒς νÎ­ου γÏρου παιχνιδιÏŽν, αυξÎ¬νονται το μÎ­γιστο, τÏŒσο στην αναπαραγωγÎ® ÏŒσο και στην απÏŒλαυση του παιχνιδιοÏ, και για τους 2 και 4 παÎ¯κτες ...

The famous tank battle of World War II, between the Red Army & the German Army, lives through the exceptional cards of the game. The accurate elements of all the units, the unique tactics, the high level strategy & the ability to create a unique conflict in every start of a new game round, are growing the most, in both playability & enjoyment of the game, for both 2 and 4 players.

How to play:
The game can be played either with 1 vs 1 or 2 vs 2 as pairs.
Each player or pair, takes the role of either the German Army or the Soviet Army.

The game has a damage point system to figure the winner. The first player who reaches 20 points (40 points for 4 players) on board meter, will be the winner of the battle. Damage points are equal to life points (red cross with specific number in each card).

Every card has 7 different sectors (boxes):

Upper: from left to right :
First box - Velocity of weapon
Second box -  Weapon's Penetration level 
Third box - Own armor level
Fourth box - Own life points

Lower:
First box - movement 
Middle Double number target - 2 x 12sided dice (black for German/White for Soviet), both numbers in dice is the damage area for the weapon. A 10 on the dice is a Critical hit & any unit who receives this damage must be removed from the battle ground.
Finally, the blue pointer with the specific number is the encounter points needed for this unit to use it in the deployment phase of the battle.

Each turn:
1. Encounter points (both armies start with 5 each)
2. Draw phase - each player draws 2 cards
3. Move phase - each player can move their units
4. Deployment phase - each player can deploy any unit if he has the necessary encounter points
5. Engagement phase - each player can attack the enemy player based on the abilities of their units
6. Discard phase
7. End of turn

Before the first turn all players must draw 5 cards each and receives 5 encounter tokens. There is a 7 card hand limit. Some cards can give the player the ability to draw a general commander
card from their own general deck.

There can be no more than 2 generals active during the battle, but a player can change a general card by discarding the old one and playing a new one.

Each general gives 1 additional encounter points in the beginning of each turn. Also, each player receives 1 encounter point every turn and 1 additional point for every unit deployed in the battlefield.

Players can combine cards if it is allowed in the card's description but only until the end of the turn (except the end of battle for some cards)

Air units are visible during the battle and while performing an attack. If enemy anti-aircraft wapons are available, they must be countered

Units with low penetration levels cannot attach enemy units with higher armor level.

Special cards can give the player's units unique abilities during each battle.

First player who reach 20/40 points will be the winner of the battle & the game ends.

Name: Tensor Chess
Description:
As in classical chess, the object of Tensor Chess is to checkmate the opponent's king.

The game is played on an 8X10 board with a new piece added to the array; the Tensor Beast.

The Beast Manuevers dependent on interacting with the new piece.  The beast can move one square in any direction like the king.

The beast can also leap forward or backward over its own or opposing pieces and land on the next square if that square is unoccupied. It can leap diagonally, or leap horizontally along a row (rank) and vertically along a column (file). The beast can hop both vertically and horizontally on the same turn, but horizontal and vertical leaping cannot be combined with diagonal leaping.

The beast cannot move one square and then begin leaping. Nor can it leap and simply return to its starting square as this would be skipping a turn. It can, however, return to its starting square on the same turn if it captures an opposing beast by its final leap.

The beast can only capture an opposing beast and can only be captured by an opposing beast. A beast captures an enemy beast by hopping over it rather than landing on the same square.

For example, a beast may hop over an enemy beast, not capture it, and proceed to hop over and capture another beast.

Or a beast may hop over an opposing beast, and not capture it on that first hop, but then hop back over the opposing beast (moving in the other direction) and capture it on that hop, all on the same turn.

In addition A bishop, rook or queen can pass through a beast of its own color, but not through an enemy beast.

A beast acts as a shield for its own pieces and blocks opposing pieces.

A pass through may involve more than one beast.

A king may pass through only when castling.

Similarly there are unique ricocheting and propelling moves associated with the Beast.

A beast may pass through another beast when propelled.

A pawn may pass through only on its first move and only when moving forward to an unoccupied square.  Pawns cannot pass though and capture.

Name: Onium
Description:
Nanoadaptation of Pentaquark.


An even smaller quantum solo game.

Onium is a 6-card solitaire game in which the player tries to gather the requested data on an element called onium from a particle collider.

The game proceeds in a sequence of attempts. During each attempt, the player will roll a black and a white die (and if possible an additional scattered die). If the die-roll seems unsuitable, the roll may be discarded by scattering the dice. This can be done only a limited number of times.

The player may alter the results with special abilities, if these are charged up. After that, the dice are assigned to their respective detectors (depending on die color and number).

Dice of opposite color in the same detector annihilate. If there are dice of opposite color and the same number in detectors, these will form onium (and be removed). The player may optionally remove a set of dice to charge a special ability.

The game is lost if the player exceeds a given amount of annihilations or onium, or if they don't have enough dice for another attempt. The player wins by recording the required amount of onium.


Released in the November 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Wings of War: World War 1 – De Havilland D.H.4
Description: This is a miniature bi-plane for Wings of War / Wings of Glory miniature game.

Name: Paw Patrol Pups In Training
Description:
Paw Patrol Pups in Training is a frantic, real-time game in which players mash spring-loaded "flippers" that cause their pups to leap into the air and -- hopefully! -- knock badges and treats off of a spinning, overhead carousel.

There are four badges and eight treats in all, with 'Badges' worth 3 points and 'Treats' 1 point each.  When all badges and treats have been knocked off the carousel the players add up their points and the player with the most points wins!

(Game play is similar in style to Hungry Hungry Hippos.)

From the website:

Paw Patrol is on a roll!

Spring into action with the Paw Patrol Pups In Training Game! Your mission is to collect as many treats and badges as you can from the spinning target ring. Set up is easy, just place the treats and badges on the target ring and give it a spin. Then get behind your favorite Paw Patrol Character and press the Pup Flipper.

When you knock off a badge or treat hold on to it, each one is worth points. The player with the most points at the end wins!

(No batteries required.)

Name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Junkers Ju.87
Description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

This two-seat German ground-attack aircraft first flew in 1935, and made its combat debut during the Spanish Civil War.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Hawker Hurricane
Description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

This British single-seat fighter aircraft earned renown during the Battle of Britain

—description from the publisher
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Supermarine Spitfire
Description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

The signature fighter plane of the RAF, the Supermarine Spitfire was a fast, highly-maneuverable single-seater.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Isle of Skye: Druids
Description:
One cannot win the struggle for dominance over the island without powerful allies. As every wise king knows, power is not measured in strength and gold alone. Having the support of the spiritual leaders of the country can be the decisive factor. Win the druids over to your cause, and harness the power of their mystical sacred sites for your benefit!

Isle of Skye: Druids, the second expansion for Isle of Skye, can be played with the base game on its own or with the base game and the Journeyman expansion. This expansion splits the buying phase (phase 4) into two buying sessions. With your first purchase, you can buy a tile from your fellow players in the usual manner. For your second purchase, you can buy a tile from the dolmen board. These "druid" tiles are normal landscape tiles, except that they will often bear a stone tablet or a scroll. Stone tablets grant special powers that you can use until the end of the game, while scrolls are subject to the usual rules of the base game.

New scoring tiles offer further variability.

Name: Lines of Battle: Game of Napoleonic Tactics
Description:
The battle lines have been drawn!  Lines of Battle is a simple yet clever Napoleonic game system that allows tactical situations to be played out with a minimum of rules in a short amount of time.  It's all here: Infantry, Cavalry, Artillery but also a challenging system of command/control that adds a chess like feel to an otherwise straightforward wargame.

Each of your three leaders projects a horizontal, vertical and diagonal line of command.  The length of this line depends on a leader's rank. 
 A simple and concise chit pull system determines initiative while a bare bones D6 combat system moves battles along quickly and decisively across a 13 x 13 square battle grid.

Numerous ways to win include: Capturing your opponents objectives, eliminating leaders or simply inflicting more casualties than you receive.  Includes 6 scenarios or you may build your own!

This is a free print n play game, our way of saying thanks to a wargaming community that is both friendly and helpful.

Name: Cube Hog
Description:
Cube Hog is a 2-4 player family/party style card game all about using strategy, luck, and even slight of hand to "hog" more cubes than your opponents!

Gameplay: Learning to play Cube Hog takes only a couple minutes. Each player is assigned a color (Red, Blue, Green, Yellow) and given their color player cubes, 5 to each player. Cubes are all pink except the underside which has a hidden player color. Each color is given a value card facedown to dictate what each color cube is worth.

For example: If the blue player has a 1 on their value card, then the cubes that have blue on their hidden underside are each only worth 1.

Players take turns playing action cards to best their opposition. Action cards are used to steal, swap, and flip cubes over to reveal the underside. Action cards also can be used to look at other players value cards, flip over value cards for everyone to see, or even to change a value card. The player with the highest value of cubes at the end of the round wins the game!

Cube Hog can be played in two ways. Quickplay is the fastest way to pick up and play. Quickplay games last about 10 minutes and a great for some quick fun. Competitive play consists of multiple games of Cube Hog with each game won rewards the player with a Gold Cube. Playing this takes about 45 minutes. This also adds the 'Gold Cube' card into the deck to add a new mechanic specifically designed for competitive play. First player to win 3 gold cubes wins the competitive play game!

Cube Hog rewards players who can remember which cube is which while the cubes slowly get shuffled around the table. However, players are also rewarded when they use sleight of hand to shuffle their own cubes to fool other players.

Name: Sculptapalooza
Description: In Sculptapalooza, teams race against the clock to sculpt with playfoam, guess, and win in five categories such as sculpting with your eyes closed, sculpting a prop to act out your scene, or running through tag-team play in the lightning round.

Name: The Amazing Kreskin's Celtic Oracle Game
Description:
Players select a series of yes/no questions from randomly drawn oracle cards.  After the question is read, players secretly vote which answer the claw-shaped, oracular pendulum will provide.  Once the other players have voted, the reader swings the oracle until a yes or no answer is indicated.

The player holding the oracle receives 1 point for each correct match as does each player who correctly matches the oracle's answer.

Play continues for 5 rounds and the points are tallied to determine a winner.

Name: Master of Wills: Dawnlight Expansion Faction Deck
Description:
Dawnlight is a powerful organization who view themselves as spirtual heoes. They try to achieve angelic states through technology which present powers that no other faction can proclaim. They protect and influence community characters with a mystical presence. Are they fighting for the greater good or will their extremism take them down a darker path?

“Dawnlight is a powerful organization who view themselves as spirtual heoes. They try to achieve angelic states through technology which present powers that no other faction can proclaim. They protect and influence community characters with a mystical presence. Are they fighting for the greater good or will their extremism take them down a darker path?

—description from the publisher

Name: Card Goblins: Expansão Faroeste
Description:
Western-themed expansion for Card Goblins, containing 15 cards.

Shuffle these cards into the main deck and proceed as normal.

Name: SlapStick
Description: In SlapStick, a group of 3 to 8 players read among 110 cards with silly "would you rather" style questions. Answer convincingly and the leader holds up the "slap stick" (literally a long stick with a foam five-finger hand) teasing it near the player's cheek. Answer incorrectly, and oh, boy...mayhem ensues.

Name: POOP: Kawaii
Description: An English / Japanese Dual Language Version of POOP! A fresh version of the hit game, where your goal is to lay a card, but don’t clog the toilet!

Name: Keep Calm: Expansion One
Description:
The first expansion. More situations and a renewed decision to make (only this pack comes with an EXPLICIT CONTENT warning label): do you panic or keep calm?

Keep Calm is a party game where players vie to take control of situations by suggesting the best course of action to their friends in sticky situations. What do you do if your prom date turns into a werewolf? Keep calm and accept your mortality? Keep calm and give up on finding love?

In addition, players can play Panic cards to mess with gameplay in various ways, from skipping a judge to discarding responses.

The first person to take control of 6 situations wins!

Name: Game of Phones: Expansion 002 – Materialism Pack
Description: The second expansion pack to the wildly popular Game of Phones game, where there are 30 all-new cards to play with the main game. Game of Phones is a race to find the best or weirdest things on your smartphone to win. Tap faster, out-culture and think cooler than the people around you to win!

Name: It Dies With Me
Description:
In most games - even your favorite one - there’s nothing really serious at stake. But, It Dies With Me is different. Take a peek into the soul; the deep, dark, twisted heart of your opponent. The player that wins, will learn a secret, something never told to anyone! One player at the table has a secret, and it's about them. They've even written in down and placed it in a secret envelope on the table. Do you want to read it? WIN THE GAME. The secret can never be shared, or be repeated. That's because it's written on EDIBLE PAPER with a FOOD COLORING MARKER, and it must be EATEN to make sure the secret DIES with the winner of the game!

Each player (including the player whose secret is in the game) has one six sided die and a mini coffin. Players use their coffins to hide a secret die number they've chosen, trying to be the highest or lowest unique number. That's right, no rolling of these dice. Players can choose any number from one to six. Everyone opens their coffin at the same time to see who wins each round. Choose wisely, or your number might get cancelled out!

Each round there are TWO winners! One winner draws a card. The other moves their token. Players try to collect a set of four cards to form the phrase: IT - DIES - WITH - ME. OR, move their token across the six grave tiles, all the way to the SECRET ENVELOPE. Complete just one of these goals, and you win. You get to READ THE SECRET! Just remember, that secret must die with you.

Name: Ultimate Conspiracy
Description:
1920, Witsand City, several young women mysteriously disappeared without leaving any trace. The police suspect a serial killer. You're going to investigate and find out it's much more than that. An incredible machination awaits you and many people are involved.

Your goal will be to unravel all this and put an end to this conspiracy forever!

For your investigations, you will have to choose from 6 very different characters. Depending on your choice, you will not experience exactly the same adventure.

The abilities of each character are: strength, charisma, intelligence, skill, and search.

In addition to these abilities, you will gain additional skills during the game. These skills will be very different for each character. They will be very important to the success of your missions and you will keep them from one investigation to the next. Your characters will also have health and mental health points. You will have to watch them very carefully, because if they fall to zero, your character will either be dead or completely crazy.

Ultimate Conspiracy is a true narrative game, you will not only have to thwart a conspiracy, but also complete many secondary quests that will help you in your investigation. You will also find many objects, but as in real life, you won't be able to carry as many as you want. Each object has a size score and this is limited according to the characters and their strengths.

You all play against the game together. You decide which character should do which action? Is it better to stay together or separate?

To solve each investigation, you will visit different places in the city, in the country and even in the world.

Playing Ultimate Conspiracy is very simple, you are free to visit the places you want in the order of your choice and as many times as you feel necessary.

You’ll have to solve many puzzles to progress in your investigation. Keep in mind to observe the items as a whole and if the solution seems complicated, do not hesitate to come back to it later.

In between time, money, investigations and puzzles, you’ll always be under pressure in Ultimate Conspiracy.

—description from the publisher

Name: Munchkin: Valentine's Day Monster Box
Description:
More storage than a box of chocolates!

Do you and your sweetheart have lots of Munchkin stuff? Do you want a way to bring it on your romantic picnic? Then this Monster Box holds the answer to all your heart's desires! You'll have room to lovingly care for more than 2,000 Munchkin cards, a Level Playing Field, some Seals and Dungeons, and all your other alluring Munchkin swag – all with adorable art by Katie Cook.

To get you started, it includes twelve holiday-themed Munchkin cards that you can shuffle into any game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Reaper Expansion Pack
Description:
Engineered as a high-performance troop transport for in-atmosphere missions, the TIE reaper also made its debut in Rogue One. Equipped with advanced ailerons for precise atmospheric maneuvering, thick armor plating, powerful laser cannons, and the capacity to carry elite infantry, this menacing vessel struck fear into Rebel forces across the galaxy.

Any TIE reaper that you choose to fly in your squadron packs a potent strike, rolling three attack dice as its primary weapon attack. A TIE reaper is not especially agile, leaving it with only a single defense die, but with six hull and two shields, these starships are durable enough to stick around on the battlefield. In fact, TIE reapers bring something quite special to your Imperial X-Wing squadrons. This ship bears the unusual jam action that lets you jam nearby ships and prevent them from using a focus, evade, or target lock—opening a wealth of tactical opportunities when you’re building your squad or flying into battle.

In the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Reaper Expansion Pack, you'll find the pre-painted TIE reaper miniature, four different ship cards, eleven upgrade cards, a maneuver dial, and all the other tokens that you need to bring the Empire's deadliest troopers into the heat of battle.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Saw's Renegades Expansion Pack
Description:
Take the skies with Saw Gerrera and his renegades with the Saw's Renegades Expansion Pack for the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game! Rather than introducing completely new ships to the game, this expansion follows in the vein of the Rebel Aces Expansion Pack and the Heroes of the Resistance Expansion Pack by introducing new versions of existing ships already in the service of the Rebel Alliance. In this case, you'll find two new ship miniatures: a U-wing and a T-65 X-wing, both pre-painted in the stunning red-and-white paint scheme of Saw Gerrera's freedom fighters.

Though the ships may be functionally the same as the ones included in previous expansions, the Saw's Renegades Expansion Pack offers an assortment of ship cards featuring pilots from Saw's motley band of warriors — or even Saw Gerrera himself, flying his powerful U-wing into your battles. Along with new ship cards for both the T-65 X-wing and the U-wing, you'll find an arsenal of fifteen new upgrade cards, equipping your squadrons with any number of unusual tactics or system upgrades.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Gnome's Lunch
Description:
These gnomes have an unusually big appetite for their size! Connect as many gnome tiles to the pizza tiles as you can to collect the most points. Beware of the dragons — they scare away the gnomes... unless the gnomes team up against the dragons. Surrounded, the dragons will have no other option but to flee!

Gnome’s Lunch is a minimalistic board game with 1-minute rules and a very rich gameplay: tactics, bluff, player interaction and lots of fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rainbow
Description:
El cielo se ha nublado, se avecina tormenta. ¿Serás capaz de conseguir formar el arcoíris?
RAINBOW es un divertido juego para toda la familia donde deberás de forma ordenada conseguir formar tu arcoíris. Pero no será fácil, si bien el sol y la lluvia te ayudarán, las nubes, viento y tormentas te lo impedirán.
RAINBOW es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores, a partir de 5 años de edad, con mecánica sencilla de conseguir cartas y evitar que tu rival lo consiga.
La mecánica de juego es muy fácil. Muestra una carta del mazo de arcoiris y otra del mazo de clima, y debes ir colocandola en tu zona de juego o "cielo", considerando que si ya tienes una carta similar estarás obligado a colocarla en otro cielo que no sea el tuyo. El primer jugador en conseguir los siete colores del arcoiris ganará.
El juego contiene un total de 4 arcoíris completos (28 cartas), y 50 cartas de clima que permite la interacción.

The sky is cloudy, storm is coming. Will you be able to make the rainbow?

RAINBOW is a fun game for the whole family where you must neatly arrange your rainbow. However, it will not be easy. The sun and the rain will help you while clouds, winds, and storms will prevent it.

RAINBOW is a game of 2 to 4 players, from 5 years of age, with simple mechanics to get cards and prevent your opponent from getting it.

The mechanics of the game are very easy. It shows a card from the rainbow deck and another from the climate deck, and you must place it in your game zone or "sky", considering that if you already have a similar card you will be forced to place it in another sky that is not yours. The first player to get the seven colors of the rainbow will win.

The game contains a total of 4 complete rainbows (28 cards), and 50 weather cards that allow interaction.

Name: Enchanted Paths
Description:
In a far away land, magical beings roam the Enchanted Paths — a fire-breathing dragon and a pure unicorn, a wise wizard and a brave knight, a cackling witch and a beautiful princess... Help the fairytale characters find their way to each other. Fold the game board to connect creatures and items. In order to win, you have to be the first to complete the task, so hurry up!

In the Enchanted Paths board game each player receives a special magical game board, which can be folded in 24 different ways. The goal of the game is to fold your game board correctly, and complete the task faster than the other players. The tasks differ in complexity. There are 90 challenge cards in the game: 30 easy challenges and 60 difficult challenges.

The challenge cards show the number of game characters that need to be seen (or connected by paths) on a game board. In order to complete an easy task, a player needs to fold the game board in such a way, that the required number of creatures or items can be seen on one side of the board. The difficult challenge requires the game characters to not only to be seen on one side of the game board, but also to be connected by paths. The first player to complete the task correctly receives a card, as a reward. The game ends as soon as one player collects 5 cards with competed tasks.

Play the game on both levels of difficulty with your friends or alone. Change the magical world of Enchanted Paths as you please, and help the fairytale characters meet. Set new records, and have lots of fun with this fantastic board game!

Name: Aqualiens
Description:
Aqualiens is a fun boardgame for kids, in which players use special transparent cards to complete the tasks, and help the adorable creatures collect as many seashells as they can.

Meet the aqualiens - creatures that live on the bottom of a deep blue ocean. They really like seashells and, as everyone knows, you can never have too many seashells! They have learned to grow new arms and tentacles, so they can always grab just one more shell. Help them transform correctly, and collect as may sea treasures as they can carry.

In the Aqualiens board game each player receives one of the four cute aliens. Transparent cards and goal cards are placed in the center of the table, so everyone can reach them. Lay the transparent cards with arms and tentacles on top of your alien card to complete the task, but make sure to use as few cards as possible! The quickest player to grow and collect everything that's needed, according to the goal card, wins a victory crystal.

When the players are already good in playing with basic rules, they can try to make the game more complex, by adding some extra rules. In addition to arms and tentacles, the players have to collect a certain amount of seashells on the card of their alien. Note that if some player stops the round by saying "I'm ready!", and it turns out that the task is made incorrectly, then the player loses one victory crystal! The first player who receives 5 victory crystals wins the game.

Name: Speed Colors: Booster Pack №1
Description:
Can’t get enough of Speed Colors? Are you tempted to color everything around you? There’s a fix for you! Introducing Speed Colors Booster Pack, a Speed Colors extension containing 12 never-before-seen image cards and 6 rainbow-colored markers for even more colorful entertainment.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chill Out!
Description:
A bevy of freshly-squeezed drinks waits to be served — all they need is ice! Roll the color die, choose a matching tray, scoop up the ice cubes, then drop them one at a time around the board, hoping to land some in your cup. Snag a blueberry for extra points, but watch out for slippery hands trying to snag your cubes! Fill up the frostiest float in Chill Out! and you're the coolest!

—description from the publisher
